Key Match Events: Shaheen Shah Afridi helped Pakistan end on a high with a three-wicket win over Ireland.
Pakistan finished third in the five-team group with four points after losing to India and the United States.
Ireland finished bottom with one point from the washout against Canada, ending their campaign without a win.
Pakistan openers Mohammed Rizwan and Saim Ayub (both 17) fell during the powerplay.
Barry McCarthy (3-15) dismissed Usman Khan and Shadab Khan in the same over, leaving Pakistan looking shaky at 57-5.
Babar Azam (32 not out) anchored the innings and Pakistan chased down the target with seven balls to spare.
Pakistan's Shaheen Shah Afridi took 3-22 and Imad Wasim took 3-8 to help Pakistan win the match.
Ireland's Gareth Delany scored 31 off 19 balls to help Ireland reach 106-9.
Pakistan's Imad Wasim took 3 wickets in 3 consecutive overs to turn the match in Pakistan's favor.
Pakistan's Babar Azam scored 32 not out to help Pakistan win the match.
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan won the toss and chose to bowl.
Shaheen Shah Afridi said he was trying to strike early on and follow his plan.
Pakistan need 5.35 an over to win – I’ll be back as soon as the kettle has boiled to take you through their chase.
Post-Match Reflections: Paul Stirling said Ireland played well in patches but blew their top order away.
Babar Azam said Pakistan have some close games but didn't finish well and have some good individuals but didn't play well as a team.
Pakistan must now return home to an unhappy nation, Ireland also to lick their wounds.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in Florida at Lauderhill’s Central Broward Park stadium.
The weather was hot and humid, with spectators fanning themselves from the heat.
Pakistan finished their T20 World Cup campaign with a three-wicket win over Ireland.
Ireland finished bottom of the group with one point from the tournament.
